title: Norway Wins Everything. The Olympics End Today.
summary: Milan Cortina 2026 closes with Norway dominating, USA setting records, and host Italy in the top 4.
content:
The closing ceremony is tonight. Milan Cortina 2026 is over.

## 18 | Gold medals for Norway

Eighteen golds out of 116 events. Eleven silvers. Eleven bronzes. **40 total medals.** Norway didn't compete at these Olympics — they occupied them.

The United States had its **best Winter Games ever.**

## 11 | US gold medals — a single-Games record

32 total medals. Second in the table. The Americans found their stride in freestyle skiing, snowboarding, and a mixed aerials gold on the final weekend.

Host nation Italy delivered.

## 10 | Italian golds on home ice and snow

30 total medals, fourth overall. The home crowd got what they came for.

>> "Johannes Høsflot Klæbo completed his clean sweep of cross-country distances — a historic achievement." — Olympics.com

The Netherlands dominated speed skating. Japan surprised with 24 total medals. France punched above their weight at 23.

111 of 116 events complete. The final five — including women's 50km cross-country — finish today before the flame goes out.

!! Two weeks of competition. 116 events. Norway reminded the world that winter belongs to the north.
